title: No-deal Brexit nerves grip the German home town of Volkswagen
text:
There is no mistaking the main business in Wolfsburg. The vast Volkswagen factory towers over the city centre. To all intents and purposes, it is the city centre. More than 50,000 people people work inside the complex, which has three power stations of its own. There are corridors over a mile long, and the factory floor is so large the workers need bicycles to get from one end to the other.

Cars are exported around the world from here. Wolfsburg has the highest GDP per capita in Germany at €178,000 (£159,000) — more than twice that of London. This is the jewel in the crown of the German car industry.

But there is a distinct nervousness in the air in Wolfsburg. Insiders at VW say conversation...
description: There is no mistaking the main business in Wolfsburg.
